review: I have only used it a couple of days, but so far I am thrilled with it. Unlike the Chromecast it replaced, the Fire TV Stick has it's own user interface and is not dependent on a smart phone or PC to cast content. The fact that it is dual band is what sold me on the device. With a dual band router, only a couple of the dozen or so WiFi connected devices would work on the 5ghz channel. So the Fire TV Stick has 30mbps practically to itself and delivers beautiful HD quality content. Also, my Vizio TV remote works most of the features thanks to the HDMI CEC compatibility. I mistakenly hit a button on my TV remote and discovered that it worked the Fire TV Stick also.The search feature is a little cumbersome because of the limited controls on the Fire remote, but that is overshadowed by the other positives. Setup was a breeze, actually much easier than the Chromecast it replaced. The bigger memory and flash memory cache means that I don't get the streaming spooling delays that were frequent with the Chromecast. We still have one other Chromecast we are actively using and I will probably replace it with another Fire TV Stick.We are able to access all the same content we normally access on the Chromecast, plus Amazon Prime Video.
